themes: Administrative burden of grant application portals
Misalignment of funding cycles with programming needs
City's role in promotion of funded programs
Economic challenges for visual arts as 'for-profit'
Inequity in promotional support for visual arts
Inconsistent funding principles across art disciplines
key_phrases: The Zoom Grants portal is CUMBERSOME
The award cycle is protracted and affects programs
not compatible with COA fiscal year (fall)
City should be the one to promote all funded programs to tourists, not just the orgs/projects funded
Visual arts, though considered a 'for-profit' enterprise, is not commercially viable
Austin Chronicle only promotes 'free' visual arts events
Music department distinguishes between commercial and non-commercial music enterprises, other art disciplines funded by city should be guided by same principles
barriers_identified: Misalignment between funding cycle and optimal program timing
Lack of city-led promotion for all funded programs
Visual arts not commercially viable despite 'for-profit' label
Limited promotional support for non-free visual arts events
solutions_proposed: City should promote all funded programs to tourists, not just those funded
Other art disciplines funded by city should be guided by same principles as music department regarding commercial vs non-commercial distinction
